movies.title: The Feather Fairy
movies.plot: A fairy-tale about an old lady who takes care of snow and Jakub who does not fear death. It reflects the idea of people's longing for happiness, love and understanding, their effort to overcome troubles and win over death. It criticizes greed and evil desires.
movies.simplePlot: The Feather Fairy lives in the sky and gives snow to the people. She lives with a boy called Jakob, who one day ventures into the human world and falls for a peasant girl.

biography.placeOfBirth: San Giorgio di Piano, Emilia-Romagna, Italy
biography.bio: Born in San Giorgio di Piano, Giulietta Masina spent part of her teenage years living with a widowed aunt in Rome, where she cultivated a passion for the theater and studied for a degree in Philosophy. She began her career on the radio with the program "Terzoglio" (1942), about the adventures of newlyweds Cico and Pallina from scripts written by Federico Fellini. The series brought her great success. The following year she married Fellini and became the inspirational muse for many of his films. She made her cinema debut in Sans pitié (1948), directed by Alberto Lattuada, but really established her reputation with her next few films: Behind Closed Shutters (1951), directed by Luigi Comencini, Variety Lights (1951), which also marked Fellini's debut as director (the film credits both Fellini and Lattuada); and Europe '51 (1952), directed by Roberto Rossellini. Her artistic partnership with her husband really took off with the Oscar-winning La Strada (1954), followed by Il Bidone (1955) and the widely acclaimed The Nights of Cabiria (1957), which again won an Oscar and brought her the award for Best Female Performance at the Cannes Film Festival. Over the following years she played many memorable roles in such films as Fortunella (1958), directed by Eduardo De Filippo; ...and the Wild Wild Women (1959), directed by Renato Castellani; and later in Juliet of the Spirits (1965) and Ginger and Fred (1986), both directed by Fellini. From 1966 to 1969 she hosted the immensely popular radio show "Lettere aperte a Giulietta Masina" and starred in the television series Eleonora (1973), by Tullio Pinelli, directed by Silverio Blasi, and Camilla (1976), directed by Sandro Bolchi, based on the novel by Fausta Cialente, "Un inverno freddissimo" (1966). She died in Rome in 1994, just a few months after the death of her husband.
biography.name: Giulietta Masina

biography.bio: Petra Vancíková was born on June 25, 1966 in Bratislava, Czechoslovakia. She is an actress, known for The Feather Fairy (1985), Husiarka a král (1983) and Nekdo schází u stolu (1988).
biography.name: Petra Vancíková

biography.bio: Tobias Hoesl was born on September 29, 1961 in Munich, Bavaria, West Germany as Tobias Hösl. He is an actor, known for The Feather Fairy (1985), Lockwood Desert, Nevada (1986) and The Polar Bear King (1991).
biography.name: Tobias Hoesl

biography.bio: Sona Valentová was born on June 3, 1946 in Trnava, Czechoslovakia. She is an actress, known for Witchhammer (1970), The Feather Fairy (1985) and Lea (1996). She is married to Pavol Haspra.
biography.name: Sona Valentová

biography.bio: Pavol Mikulík was born on March 2, 1944 in Presov, Czechoslovakia. He was an actor, known for The Feather Fairy (1985), The Devil's Smile (1987) and The Curator of Outdoor Museum (1989). He died on November 28, 2007 in Bratislava, Slovakia.
biography.name: Pavol Mikulík

biography.bio: Milada Ondrasíková is an actress, known for The Feather Fairy (1985).
biography.name: Milada Ondrasíková

biography.bio: Valérie Kaplanová was born on September 12, 1917 in Hlinsko, Bohemia, Austria-Hungary. She was an actress, known for Jára Cimrman Lying, Sleeping (1983), The Feather Fairy (1985) and Artus, Merlin a Prchlici (1995). She died on May 13, 1999 in Pardubice, Czech Republic.
biography.name: Valérie Kaplanová

biography.bio: Eva Horká was born on July 10, 1967 in Prague, Czechoslovakia [now Czech Republic]. She is an actress, known for The Feather Fairy (1985), Strom pohádek: Divoké labute (1988) and O spící princezne, sípkových ruzích a urazené víle (1983).
biography.name: Eva Horká

biography.bio: Ludovit Reiter was born on October 18, 1915. He was an actor, known for The Feather Fairy (1985), I Love, You Love (1989) and If I Had a Gun (1971). He died on May 10, 1999 in Povazská Bystrica, Slovakia.
biography.name: Ludovit Reiter

biography.bio: Karel Effa was born on May 23, 1922 in Prague, Czechoslovakia as Karel Effenberger. He was an actor, known for Amadeus (1984), Lemonade Joe (1964) and Who Wants to Kill Jessie? (1966). He died on June 11, 1993 in Prague, Czech Republic.
biography.name: Karel Effa

biography.bio: Vlastimir Drbal is an actor, known for The Feather Fairy (1985), Drátenická pohádka (1987) and The Little Shepherd Boy from the Valley (1983).
biography.name: Vlastimir Drbal

biography.bio: Emanuel Hason is an actor, known for The Feather Fairy (1985), Safari (1986) and Letný strom radosti (1984).
biography.name: Emanuel Hason

biography.bio: Zora Kerova was born on August 11, 1950 in Prague, Czechoslovakia as Zora Ulla Keslerová. She is an actress, known for Cannibal Ferox (1981), L'éventreur de New York (1982) and The True Story of the Nun of Monza (1980).
biography.name: Zora Kerova

biography.bio: Sylvia Popovská is an actress, known for The Feather Fairy (1985).
biography.name: Sylvia Popovská

biography.bio: Ivan Palúch was born on June 20, 1940 in Zvolen, Slovakia. He was an actor, known for Prince Bajaja (1971), Marketa Lazarová (1967) and Il pleut dans mon village (1968). He died on July 3, 2015 in Martin, Slovakia.
biography.name: Ivan Palúch

titlesAwards.titleAwardOutcome: Won Sergio Trasatti Award - Special Mention
